sources.title: A Railway Station for Two
sources.description:
Waitress Vera and pianist Platon Ryabinin have met each other at the railway station of a provincial town under very unattractive circumstances. She has a fiancé, he's facing jail time for a crime he didn't commit. But the rapid development of relations proves to the heroes that they can no longer live without each other.

Year of production: 1982

Directed by: Ryazanov Eldar
Writed by: Eldar Ryazanov, Emil Braginsky
Music: Andrey Petrov
Operator: Alisov Vadim
Production designer: Borisov Alexander

Starting by: Lyudmila Gurchenko, Nonna Mordyukova, Oleg Basilashvili, Nikita Mikhalkov, Olga Volkova, Anastasia Voznesenskaya, Tatiana Dogileva, Mikhail Kononov, Alexander Shirvindt, Raisa Etush, Yunusov Temurmalik

metadata.Plot: Platon Ryabinin, a pianist, is traveling by train to a distant town of Griboedov to visit his father. He gets off to have lunch during a twenty minute stop at Zastupinsk railway station. He meets Vera, a waitress, after he refuses to pay her for the disgusting food he doesn't even touch and misses his train due to police investigation of the incident. His passport is then accidentally taken away from him by Andrei, Vera's fiancé, and his money is stolen as he waits for the next train to Griboedov. Vera learns that Platon is about to get sentenced and sent to prison in the Far East for a car accident he isn't guilty for. During the few days that Platon has to spend in Zastupinsk he and Vera develop feelings for each other...
metadata.Actors: Lyudmila Gurchenko, Oleg Basilashvili, Nikita Mikhalkov
